pullRequest.body:
Define sigma-compact subsets of a topological space and show their basic properties.

* compact sets are sigma-compact
* countable unions of (sigma-)compact sets are sigma-compact
* closed subsets of sigma-compact sets are sigma-compact.

Relate them to sigma-compact space: a set is sigma-compact iff it is a sigma-compact space (w.r.t. the subspace topology).

In a later PR, we'll show that sigma-compact measure zero sets are nowhere dense.

- [x] depends on: #7528
-----------

Similar to compact sets and spaces, we define sigma-compact subsets first, and relate sigma-compact spaces to them later.

Thanks a lot, this looks very good already!
Sorry for the wait! I think this is mostly good now, at most one more round.

Thanks!

bors d+

Would replacing this calc block by
```
  rw [‚Üê hcov]
  exact subset_iUnion K n
```
be desirable? (My sense of aesthetics is unsure.)
I think it's inconsistent to use a calc block for this one but `by rw [‚Üê hcov]; exact image_iUnion.symm` for the other one.
Fair point, agreed.

This looks like a good `simp` lemma to me, unless the linter knows better.

Is this (or the `preimage` version) true under the weaker assumptions `(f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤) (hf : Embedding f)`?

Indeed it is --- this is shown in `Embedding.isSigmaCompact_iff_isSigmaCompact_image` in `SubsetProperties.lean`.

I have pushed a change tagging this simp; let's see what CI says.
Can you use that lemma to prove this one?

This is a good place for dot notation:
```suggestion
/-- Compact sets are œÉ-compact. -/
lemma IsCompact.isSigmaCompact {s : Set Œ±} (hs : IsCompact s) : IsSigmaCompact s :=
  ‚ü®fun _ => s, fun _ => hs, iUnion_const _‚ü©
```

This looks better in reverse to me:
```suggestion
lemma Embedding.isSigmaCompact_image_iff {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {s : Set Œ±}
    (hf : Embedding f) : IsSigmaCompact (f '' s) ‚Üî IsSigmaCompact s := by
```
(obviously you'll have to tweak the proof too)
I chose the name to mirror `Embedding.isCompact_iff_isCompact_image`. Should I change that one as well?

That's a good reason for the current name; certainly I agree they should match.

Let's see if @urkud or @sgouezel agree with renaming (and flipping) both.
These names come from https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/367, so are very old and possibly before conventions were well established!

This should just be called `Embedding.is[Sigma]Compact_iff`, by analogy with [Inducing.isCompact_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/SubsetProperties.html#Inducing.isCompact_iff). The rationale is the following: most of the embeddings we consider go from a space we want to understand to a space we understand well, so this should just be thought of as a criterion for compacity on the domain, which is why we don't emphasize the image part.
Makes sense to me, renamed. (Indeed, counting all current occurrences in mathlib, I see one where we rewrite "forward" and five where we rewrite backwards.)

I think a shorter name would be clearer here, perhaps with a docstring to help:
```suggestion
/-- Sets of subtype are sigma compact if the image under a coercion is. -/
lemma isSigmaCompact_subtype {p : Œ± ‚Üí Prop} {s : Set { a // p a }} :
```
I like the change. Should I also make the analogous change to `isCompact_iff_isCompact_in_subtype`?
Let's throw this into the same decision as [the other thread](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/7576#discussion_r1350142956), and decide both the same way.

I don't have a strong opinion on this one, maybe `Subtype.isSigmaCompact_iff`? The name `isSigmaCompact_subtype` sounds a bit weird to me, it sounds like "the subtype is sigma compact" (which makes no sense ofc).
I've renamed to Subtype.isSigmaCompact_iff for now.

Slightly less verbose (but untested):
```suggestion
    IsSigmaCompact s ‚Üî IsSigmaCompact ((‚Üë) '' s : Set Œ±) :=
```
Works locally!
What's wrong with using [Set.image_preimage_eq_of_subset](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Image.html#Set.image_preimage_eq_of_subset)?
I didn't find it :-) Thanks for pointing it out!

For consistency with `CompactSpace`, `ConnectedSpace` and so on, could you replace the definition to be literally `IsSigmaCompact (univ : Set Œ±)` and then prove that it's equivalent to the current definition?
Does [Function.Surjective.iUnion_comp](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Lattice.html#Function.Surjective.iUnion_comp) help?
Indeed, it works like a charm. I'm constantly amazed how many lemmas *are* already present in mathlib.

I think this should be named either `isSigmaCompact_sUnion_of_isCompact` (I don't think it's important to emphasize on the countability in the same), or `Set.Countable.isSigmaCompact_sUnion_of_isCompact` if you want to use dot notation.

Like above, I would name that either `isSigmaCompact_sUnion` or `Set.Countable.isSigmaCompact_sUnion`. I think it's fine to make less things explicit here than in the previous version because it's strictly stronger so it should be the "default" one.

Could you also add an `iUnion` version which would take `[Countable \iota]` as a typeclass parameter, as well as a `biUnion` version analogous to [Set.Finite.isCompact_biUnion](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/SubsetProperties.html#Set.Finite.isCompact_biUnion)? You could also try to prove the indexed union version first and then deduce the `sUnion` version, imo it often gives cleaner proofs.

Added both. Indeed, proving the iUnion version first was cleaner.

I've cargo-culted the description for "biUnion" in the docstring. (Is there a central place which should have this explanation?)

```suggestion
  simp only [noetherianSpace_iff_isCompact, ‚Üê embedding_subtype_val.isCompact_iff,
```

```suggestion
`CompactSpace`, `PreirreducibleSpace`, `IrreducibleSpace`, `SigmaCompactSpace`.
```
and remove the mention below. I think it keeps consistency with the rest of the docstring.

I should have mentioned that yesterday, but I think that we should actually keep the current order and reverse the order of `Inducing.isCompact_iff`. But if that's too annoying you can keep it like that and I'll fix it in a later PR (consistency between both versions is more important).

Oh well... I have flipped this back, and also changed `Inducing.isCompact_iff`.
If you realize further inconsistencies, be invited to PR that yourself :-)

This looks a bit weird. There's no definitive rule here, but I think it's nice to simply do:
```suggestion
  have := calc
          ‚ãÉ i, s i
```
The type of the `have` will be inferred from the content of the calc block.
I just learned you can do this! Indeed, looks better to me also.

This still looks a bit too complicated. If you add the following (either replacing `sUnion` version you already have, or using the `iUnion` version to prove the `sUnion` one):
```lean
lemma isSigmaCompact_iUnion_of_isCompact {Œπ : Type*} [hŒπ : Countable Œπ] (s : Œπ ‚Üí Set Œ±)
    (hcomp : ‚àÄ i, IsCompact (s i)) : IsSigmaCompact (‚ãÉ i, s i) := by
  rcases isEmpty_or_nonempty Œπ
  ¬∑ simp only [iUnion_of_empty, isSigmaCompact_empty]
  ¬∑ -- If Œπ is non-empty, choose a surjection f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Œπ, this yields a map ‚Ñï ‚Üí Set X.
    obtain ‚ü®f, hf‚ü© := countable_iff_exists_surjective.mp hŒπ
    exact ‚ü®s ‚àò f, fun n ‚Ü¶ hcomp (f n), Function.Surjective.iUnion_comp hf _‚ü©
```
You can do:
```suggestion
      _ = ‚ãÉ x, K.uncurry x := by rw [‚Üê iUnion_prod']
  rw [this]
  exact isSigmaCompact_iUnion_of_isCompact K.uncurry fun x ‚Ü¶ (hcomp x.1 x.2)
```
But maybe I'm nit-picking too much...
If you prefer this, I don't mind. Added.

```suggestion
  exact fun n ‚Ü¶ (hcompact n).image_of_continuousOn (hf.mono (hcov.symm ‚ñ∏ subset_iUnion K n))
```
Indeed I think it's a bit weird to insist on that here. This is explained in https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Data.Set.Accumulate
import Mathlib.Data.Set.Basic
```
Actually, the new import was unnecessary; I've removed it.
Super nitpick: you can golf this lemma by deducing it from `IsCompact.isSigmaCompact` :grin:
Indeed, done. (The previous proof was essentially that argument inlined; re-using Compact.empty is both shorter and more mathlib style.)

```suggestion
  -- Choose a decomposition s_i = ‚ãÉ K_i,j for each i.
It should be easy to deduce this from the indexed version, could you do so?
Done; this is nicer indeed.

```suggestion
/-- If `s` is œÉ-compact and `f` is continuous on `s`, `f(s)` is œÉ-compact.-/

```suggestion
/-- If `f : X ‚Üí Y` is `Inducing`, the image `f '' s` of a set `s` is œÉ-compact
  if and only `s`` is œÉ-compact. -/
lemma Inducing.isSigmaCompact_iff {f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤} {s : Set Œ±}
    (hf : Inducing f) : IsSigmaCompact s ‚Üî IsSigmaCompact (f '' s) := by
  constructor
  ¬∑ exact fun h ‚Ü¶ h.image hf.continuous
  ¬∑ rintro ‚ü®L, hcomp, hcov‚ü©
    -- Suppose f(s) is œÉ-compact; we want to show s is œÉ-compact.
    -- Write f(s) as a union of compact sets L n, so s = ‚ãÉ K n with K n := f‚Åª¬π(L n) ‚à© s.
    -- Since f is inducing, each K n is compact iff L n is.
    refine ‚ü®fun n ‚Ü¶ f ‚Åª¬π' (L n) ‚à© s, ?_, ?_‚ü©
    ¬∑ intro n
      have : f '' (f ‚Åª¬π' (L n) ‚à© s) = L n := by
        rw [image_preimage_inter, inter_eq_left.mpr]
        exact (subset_iUnion _ n).trans hcov.le
      exact hf.isCompact_iff.mpr (this.symm ‚ñ∏ (hcomp n))
    ¬∑ calc ‚ãÉ n, f ‚Åª¬π' L n ‚à© s
        _ = f ‚Åª¬π' (‚ãÉ n, L n) ‚à© s  := by rw [preimage_iUnion, iUnion_inter]
        _ = f ‚Åª¬π' (f '' s) ‚à© s := by rw [hcov]
        _ = s := inter_eq_right.mpr (subset_preimage_image _ _)
```
Actually `Inducing` is enough :wink:
You can keep the `Embedding` version too of course.
Nice find! I've changed the proof as you indicated (and kept the `Embedding` version, following the example for compact sets).

```suggestion
  rw [‚Üê isSigmaCompact_univ_iff, IsSigmaCompact]
```

```suggestion
lemma isSigmaCompact_empty : IsSigmaCompact (‚àÖ : Set Œ±) :=
  isCompact_empty.isSigmaCompact
```
